channel.title: Trouble with loading 508 Client with Vista
channel.description:
My OS is Windows Vista Premium. I can't seem to load any 508 Clients. All of them come up with the same message: 'java' is not recognized as an internal or external command, operable program or batch file. Press any key to continue...
I downloaded the .ZIP file for a 508 client. I uncompressed it, and put it in the desktop. I opened the file, and pressed the run program. But that message kept coming up. On my old computer, I just did that, and the client popped up. But this, my new computer, that uses Vista, doesn't do the same as my Windows XP computer. What should I do? Because I personally don't know. If anyone can help, please post here, or even PM me. I'm getting annoyed that I can't go on any servers, so soon would be nice. Thanks!

item.title: Trouble with loading 508 Client with Vista
item.dc:creator: @Prince_Myst Prince Myst
item.description:
@Prince_Myst wrote:

Huh? Set paths? What do you mean? I don’t understand, sorry. Can someone explain to me, what I should do exactly?

Anyone?

Read full topic

item.title: Trouble with loading 508 Client with Vista
item.dc:creator: @firewithin3 firewithin3
item.description:
@firewithin3 wrote:

You have to have your paths set on both vista AND xp, don’t blame the operating system, blame the user.

Read full topic
